data.title: Sequent founder exits IBM to go racing with
data.meta_description: Explore millions of resources from scholarly journals, books, newspapers, videos and more, on the ProQuest Platform.
data.text:
Casey Powell is off to the races.

The founder, former chief executive and chairman of Sequent Computer Systems Inc. cleaned out his desk Jan. 17, exactly 17 years to the day after a group of 17 employees started the business. Sequent hasn't existed as an independent business since being folded into IBM's server division Sept. 24.

Nearly four months after the Sequent acquisition, Powell said his role with the IBM division is finished and he's ready for a break.

"You can't have two CEO's," Powell said of his future with a division of IBM. "There didn't appear to be a role for me. It was unlikely Lou Gerstner [IBM's chief executive] would trade jobs with me."

Instead, Powell told IBM executives that he thought the Armonk, N.Y.-based company could become a major...
